# glyphImage

**Instance Property**

The image to display in the marker balloon.

## Declaration

```swift
get glyphImage(): ImageDelegate | ImageHashObject | null;
set glyphImage(value: ImageDelegate | ImageHashObject | null);
```

## Discussion

Glyph image values are object literals that contain absolute or relative URLs to standard, `@2x`, and `@3x` assets. Alternatively, you can set an [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/ImageDelegate], which is an object you use to specify image URLs.

The framework requires at least one image at 20 x 20 pixels. Create glyph images as template images — a monochrome image with opacity, if needed — so that MapKit JS can apply the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MarkerAnnotation/glyphColor] to tint the image.

If you set [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MarkerAnnotationConstructorOptions/glyphImage] to `null`, `undefined`, or “” (an empty string), MapKit JS uses the default glyph image of a pin. If you specify both a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MarkerAnnotation/glyphImage] and [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MarkerAnnotation/glyphText], MapKit JS ignores the glyph image, and the framework displays glyph text.

## Setting the glyph image and text

- **glyphText**: The text to display in the marker balloon.
- **selectedGlyphImage**: The image to display in the marker balloon when the user selects the marker.
